body: just in case - i can help with adding @internal everywhere with PHP CS Fixer

Hi, Sebastian. 
There are quite a lot o projects which may use PHPUnit via its current API and it would be nice to keep it stable. Codeception is one of them. I'd kindly ask to make all APIs used here https://github.com/Codeception/phpunit-wrapper to be considered as public API. 

Also, I know that JetBrains also heavily relies on PHPUnit internals to make their integration working. 
Not sure of issues on their side but I think we can invite them for the discussion.
JetBrains does not rely on PHPUnit internals, not since the TeamCity test listener was added to PHPUnit.

Nice thing with public API is that if sth is not marked as part of it, it can always become part of it.
But if it's already marked as public, taking it down is BC breaker.

Saying that - if we will make public API too narrow, we can always make it wider with any release (minor or even patch)
I confirm, starting with PHPUnit 5.0 PhpStorm PHPUnit integration relies only on _output_ of TeamCity.php atm

By releasing the 8.1 version of PHPUnit some breaking changes occured. I guess it's due to added strict_types declaration to some interfaces. I know that there was an issue #3236 but still it seems to be undocumented BC... ðŸ˜¢

issue.title: PHPUnit\TextUI\ResultPrinter is internal

repository.name: phpunit-pretty-result-printer
repository.description: PHPUnit Pretty Result Printer -- make your PHPUnit tests look pretty!

issue.body:
Hey,
I'm getting following deprecation notice using Phpunit 8.4.3:

```
The "PHPUnit\TextUI\ResultPrinter" class is considered internal This class is not covered by the backward compatibility promise for PHPUnit. It may change without further notice. You should not use it from "Codedungeon\PHPUnitPrettyResultPrinter\ResultPrinter80".
```

it would be great if we could get rid of that :)

issue.title: The "PHPUnit\TextUI\ResultPrinter" class is considered internal

issue.title: Make PHPUnit\TextUI\ResultPrinter an interface

labels.name: type/refactoring
labels.description: A refactoring that should be applied to make the code easier to understand and maintain

issue.body:
| Q                   | A
| --------------------| ---------------
| PHPUnit version     | 8.x+ (8.5.2 for sure)
| PHP version         | any
| Installation Method | n/a

#### Summary

The `PHPUnit\TextUI\ResultPrinter` class is marked as internal (https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/blob/master/src/TextUI/ResultPrinter.php#L29) which is causing notices to be emitted during test runs that have an external result printer configured:

https://github.com/diablomedia/phpunit-pretty-printer/issues/27
https://github.com/mikeerickson/phpunit-pretty-result-printer/issues/155
https://github.com/sempro/phpunit-pretty-print/issues/28

```
/var/www/html $ bin/phpunit --filter ArraysTest
PHPUnit 8.5.2 by Sebastian Bergmann and contributors.

Testing Project Test Suite

                       App\Tests\Common\ArraysTest ...

Time: 216 ms, Memory: 8.00 MB

OK (3 tests, 6 assertions)

Other deprecation notices (1)

  1x: The "PHPUnit\TextUI\ResultPrinter" class is considered internal This class is not covered by the backward compatibility promise for PHPUnit. It may change without further notice. You should not use it from "DiabloMedia\PHPUnit\Printer\PrettyPrinter".
```

Is it possible to have this class be part of the public API as mentioned in #3236 ?

If not, what is the recommended way to implement result printers?

Thanks!

issue.title: PHPUnit exposes an internal API to the userland
Make InvocationMocker part of the public API
issue.body:
The `InvocationMocker` interface is exposed to the userland via `MockObject::expects()`:
https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/blob/7f664ffd558ba68031963f63d3e23a951ba441fc/src/Framework/MockObject/MockObject.php#L24

According to #3236, the `@internal` annotation should be removed.

Fixes #4309.
